Additional Information  PurposeTo provide programmatic, analytical and superior executive support to Director of the Biomedical Data Sciences Hub at the UT Austin Dell Medical School. Essential FunctionsManage a complex schedule for the Director with fluid reprioritizations that will often require independent decision-making. Schedule appointments and meetings, coordinate resources and assemble appropriate reference and back-up material for all meetings. Arrange room reservations, catering, and all other necessary logistical details. Coordinate travel arrangements for the Director, faculty/staff and invited visitors. Develop itineraries, book flights, handle arrangements for ground travel, reserve meeting facilities, hotel and other necessary arrangements. Manage and process reimbursements. Assist with faculty and staff recruitment including scheduling interviews, collecting and processing applications and required forms, and collecting interviewer feedback on candidates. Develop itineraries for candidates, book flights, arrange ground travel, hotel and other related items. Manage and process reimbursements. Process and track prospective faculty appointment requests, dossiers and paperwork in centralized systems Perform high-level administrative duties such as managing office projects using tasks lists, including creating, designing and implementing processes and procedures utilizing current technology. Maintain accurate and professional correspondence logs, files, information databases, and other tracking systems as necessary. Coordinate purchase of supplies and equipment. Prepare routine, well-written correspondence for distribution and prepare correspondence on behalf of the Director. Ensure that fast-paced office is organized and that all critical areas are covered; plan for contingencies and anticipate potential problems. Maintain confidentiality as appropriate when dealing with sensitive information Assist with special projects and other tasks as related business needs arise. Maintain broad organizational perspective to effectively carry out internal and external relationships of the Department. Marginal/Incidental functionsOther related functions as assigned. Required qualificationsBachelor's degree and at least five years of experience with advanced administrative functions, particularly calendar management and other support directly for senior executives. Effective communicator with excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills. Demonstrated problem-solving and critical thinking skills. A self-starter - ability to work efficiently and flexibly in a fast-paced environment with minimal guidance. Outstanding organizational and time-management skills. Highly detail-oriented. Professional demeanor with tact and respect at all times. Ability to address individuals and information with a high degree of sensitivity and confidentiality in various delicate, formal or urgent situations. High level of proficiency with Microsoft Office programs: Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Visio, etc. Equivalent combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted as appropriate.
